trans-unit.source: Provides the form adapter class (that is, the adapter for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form"></xref>) for the HTML adapter set.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlFormAdapter"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Returns a strongly typed reference to the associated control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A strongly typed reference to the associated control.
Disables the pager user interface (UI) for the current request.
Can be called by an adapter to prevent pagination UI from being generated.
Called by the control's Render method to perform rendering.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text writer to receive output.
Renders the `<body>` tag.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The base implementation renders a `<body>` tag with the given attributes.
Inheriting adapters can override this method and modify the dictionary of attributes before calling the base implementation.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text writer.
The specified `<body>` attributes.
Renders any additional content within the `<head>` and `</ head>` tags of the HTML page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is called twice.
On the first call, the writer parameter is `null`, and the method returns `true` or `false`, indicating whether or not it has additional `<head>` elements to write.
On the second call, the method writes the content by using the provided writer.
The specified text writer.
`true` if any extra head elements were written; otherwise, `false`.
Renders the pager user interface (UI) for the form.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text writer.
Renders a pager tag on paginated forms.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method writes a link to the output stream.
The link appears on paginated forms to enable to the user to navigate between a form's pages.
Specifies the output stream.
Contains the page number of the destination page.
Specifies the text used for the link.
Returns whether to render a form tag.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
`true` if a form tag should be rendered; otherwise, `false`.
